meanings.definition: To contaminate with a disease-causing organism.
meanings.sent1: The dirty water can infect you with germs.
meanings.sent2: Washing your hands can prevent you from getting infected.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally infect my computer with a virus by clicking on a suspicious link.
meanings.sent4: Negative thoughts can infect your mind like a contagious disease.
meanings.sent5: The virus spread quickly, infecting everyone in its path.

meanings.definition: To affect or communicate a disease to.
meanings.sent1: If you sneeze without covering your mouth, you can infect others with your cold.
meanings.sent2: The flu can easily infect people during the winter months.
meanings.sent3: The rumor about the party spread so fast, it seemed to infect the whole school.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was infectious, infecting everyone around her with joy.
meanings.sent5: The contagious yawn quickly infects those nearby.

meanings.sent1: The bad influence of his friends started to infect his behavior.
meanings.sent2: The dishonesty of some politicians can infect the entire system.
meanings.sent3: The smell of burnt popcorn seemed to infect the entire office.
meanings.sent4: The greed of some individuals can infect the purity of a noble cause.
meanings.sent5: A single lie can infect the trust between friends.
